org.openimaj.vis.general

Class BarVisualisation

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • org.openimaj.vis.VisualisationImpl<List<XYPlotVisualisation.LocatedObject<O>>>
              • org.openimaj.vis.general.XYPlotVisualisation<BarVisualisation.Bar>
                • org.openimaj.vis.general.BarVisualisation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentListener, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, EventListener, Accessible, AnimatedVisualisationListener, ItemPlotter<BarVisualisation.Bar,Float[],MBFImage>, Visualisation<List<XYPlotVisualisation.LocatedObject<BarVisualisation.Bar>>>, VisualisationImageProvider

    public class BarVisualisation
extends XYPlotVisualisation<BarVisualisation.Bar>
implements ItemPlotter<BarVisualisation.Bar,Float[],MBFImage>
    The BarVisualisation can be used to draw to an image a bar graph of any data set to an RGBA MBFImage.
    Version:
    $Author$, $Revision$, $Date$
    Author:
    David Dupplaw (dpd@ecs.soton.ac.uk)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
    Created:
    26 Jul 2012

      • plotObject

        public void plotObject(MBFImage visImage,
                       XYPlotVisualisation.LocatedObject<BarVisualisation.Bar> object,
                       AxesRenderer2D<Float[],MBFImage> renderer)
        Plots a single bar into the visualisation. Plots a specific object to the visualisation using the AxesRenderer2D to provide the position of the object. Should side affect the given image.
        Specified by:
        plotObject in interface ItemPlotter<BarVisualisation.Bar,Float[],MBFImage>
        Parameters:
        visImage - The image to draw to
        object - The object
        renderer - The axes renderer
        See Also:
        ItemPlotter.plotObject(org.openimaj.image.Image, org.openimaj.vis.general.XYPlotVisualisation.LocatedObject, org.openimaj.vis.general.AxesRenderer2D)

      • isAxisAlwaysVisible

        public boolean isAxisAlwaysVisible()
        Whether the axis is always visible
        Returns:
        TRUE if the axis is always visible

      • setAxisAlwaysVisible

        public void setAxisAlwaysVisible(boolean axisAlwaysVisible)
        Set whether the axis should always be visible. If the minimum value is > 0 or maximum value < 0, then the axis will be made visible (either at the bottom or the top of the viewport respectively) if this is TRUE. This has no effect if the axis is fixed and set to a point outside the viewport.
        Parameters:
        axisAlwaysVisible - TRUE to make the axis always visible

      • getAxisLocation

        public double getAxisLocation()
        Returns the last calculated axis location
        Returns:
        the axisLocation The axis location

        Parameters:

      • isFixAxis

        public boolean isFixAxis()
        Returns whether the axis is fixed or not.
        Returns:
        the fixAxis TRUE if the axis is fixed; FALSE otherwise

      • setFixAxis

        public void setFixAxis(boolean fixAxis)
        Set whether the axis should be fixed.
        Parameters:
        fixAxis - TRUE to fix the axis; FALSE to allow it to float
